Description: Typical range for Nd:YAG laser cleaning of soft metals like Neodymium to avoid thermal damage due to its low melting point (1021°C) and moderate thermal conductivity (16.5 W/m·K); starting at 100W balances efficiency and safety. Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs for industrial cleaning; academic review in Optics and Lasers in Engineering (2018) on metal surface preparation.
Fundamental Nd:YAG wavelength with good Neodymium absorption
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning control
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of surface contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete surface cleaning
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive heat accumulation
